alert.note: Alert for Fairfield (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 7:54PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHERN FAIRFIELD COUNTY THROUGH 830 PM EDT... At 753 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Pleasantville, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, half inch hail, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Lancaster, Baltimore, Bremen, Millersport, Pleasantville, Fairfield Beach, Thurston, Rushville, West Rushville and Dumontville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If this storm becomes stronger, then a warning may be needed. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for central Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
